intro: Conyza glutinosa, commonly known as sticky fleabane, is an annual flowering plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, yellowish to white flowers that bloom in the summer months. Its leaves are typically hairy and have a sticky texture, which gives it its common name. Conyza glutinosa is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats, including fields and roadsides.
